meanings.definition: To give up or surrender control or possession of something.
meanings.sent1: The country ceded its land to the neighboring nation.
meanings.sent2: She ceded her seat to the elderly lady on the bus.
meanings.sent3: The cat ceded its favorite spot on the couch to the new puppy.
meanings.sent4: The team ceded victory to their opponents after a hard-fought match.
meanings.sent5: The king ceded his crown to the rightful heir, ending the long-standing dispute.

meanings.sent1: They ceded the territory to the invading army.
meanings.sent2: The company ceded control to a new management team.
meanings.sent3: The students ceded their study group to the incoming freshmen.
meanings.sent4: The chef ceded the kitchen to his apprentice for the evening.
meanings.sent5: The explorer ceded his discovery to the scientific community for further research.
